intro: Satureja libanotica, commonly known as Lebanese thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja libanotica thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
